text: The 1997–98 Czech First League, known as the Gambrinus liga for sponsorship reasons, was the fifth season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. ==Stadia and locations== ==League standings== ==Top goalscorer== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Horst Siegl |align="left"|Sparta Prague |13 |- !2 |align="left"| Vratislav Lokvenc |align="left"|Sparta Prague |12 |- !rowspan="2"|3 |align="left"| Pavel Pěnička |align="left"|Jablonec |rowspan="2"|11 |- |align="left"| Petr Samec |align="left"|Baník Ostrava |- !rowspan="2"|5 |align="left"| Pavel Holomek |align="left"|Boby Brno |rowspan="2"|10 |- |align="left"| Radek Drulák |align="left"|Sigma Olomouc |- !rowspan="3"|7 |align="left"| Martin Prohászka |align="left"|Kaučuk Opava |rowspan="3"|9 |- |align="left"| Ladislav Fujdiar |align="left"|České Budějovice |- |align="left"| Rudolf Otepka |align="left"|Dukla |} ==See also== * 1997–98 Czech Cup * 1997–98 Czech 2. Liga ==References== * ČMFS statistics Category:Czech First League seasons Czech Category:1997–98 in Czech football
title: 1997–98 Czech First League
